wikipedia_page.main: His Honour John Arnold Baker DL (5 November 1925 – 13 June 2016) was a British judge and a Liberal Party politician.

response: *John Arnold Baker (1925–2016), British judge and politician
*John Arnold Baker (1925–2016), British judge and politician
*John Arnold Baker, judge and Liberal parliamentary candidate; Chairman of the club.

In 1940 while reading law at University, Frankenburg volunteered for the Army,The Times House of Commons, 1950 joining the Cheshire RegimentThe Times House of Commons, 1951 and in 1941 was given his first command serving in Egypt and Palestine. In 1942 while serving in North Africa he was taken prisoner by the Germans. While a prisoner of war in Germany he continued his law studies and passed his first Bar examination.The Times House of Commons, 1950 In 1945 he was invalided out of the Army.‘FRANKENBURG, John Beeching’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2014; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 18 Nov 2014 In 1947 he was Called to the Bar, by the Inner Temple. He practised in London and on the Oxford circuit.The Times House of Commons, 1955 In 1955 he had published 'The Young Lawyer' written with J. L. Clay and John Arnold Baker. In 1958 he became Assistant Legal Adviser to the Director of Public Prosecutions. In 1960 he took up an appointment with the British Council. In 1964 he became the British Council's Legal Adviser.‘FRANKENBURG, John Beeching’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2014; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 18 Nov 2014
